extendedInfo.description: Define a phone number and/or an email address and whenever you press the big red button, the distress signal will be sent out to these recipients along with your GPS/Network location (a google maps link) and a personalized message.If you or a loved one ever walk through a dark alley, travel abroad or just need to alert someone of your whereabouts - this button will simplify explaining exactly where you are. Help can come faster and within GPS accuracy.Emergency Button will only work if you're in a place with reception to at least send the SMS text message or email.The widget can be added to your homescreen by home->menu button->add->Widgets->Emergency. The widget has 2 buttons and you have to press both within 5 seconds to make the app fire the distress signal. The double button is designed to minimize false positives.None of your information is stored or saved by Andluck. This project is open source (BSD) and hosted on google code: http://code.google.com/p/emergencybutton/ so you can see exactly what's inside if you wish.Disclaimer: this app is presented as is with no guarantee whatsoever. It won't work without reception or connectivity. You must make alternative communications arrangements to ensure that you can make emergency calls if needed. Please remember that Emergency Button by itself doesn't do emergency calls to any type of hospitals, law enforcement agencies, medical care unit or any type of emergency services.Please feel free to email your thoughts, problems, ideas, etc to contact@andluck.com

reviews.title: Simple and quick
reviews.comment: Would like to be able to add more contacts, if the one person doesn\'t get your message... Id pay for that option
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Previous version much better
reviews.comment: Should definitely bring back the previous version of a two button tap activation,  that version had the right design as the idea is to be able to activate quickly during an emergency - this new design has too many prompts (before sending a message) which defeats the purpose of an emergency button altogether.  The two button design was what made it better than other emergency apps available,  this new design has lost that advantage and has made it just like all the other apps.  The screenshot still shows a two-button activation widget - which is misleading.
reviews.author: Jonathan Loh

reviews.title: Good
reviews.comment: I just wish it\'d send it\'s messages without me needing to go through prompts. I want to hit one button once & that\'s it.
reviews.author: Matthew Yates

reviews.title: Awesome
reviews.comment: Easy to use and functional!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Life Saver
reviews.comment: Great app. I do miss the simple two button push from main screen... New confirmation pop up takes too much time. Update was downgrade IMO.
reviews.author: Gregory Capwell

reviews.title: Terrible
reviews.comment: I is so stupid
reviews.author: jessica armstrong

reviews.title: Too slow
reviews.comment: Nice idea, but the sending itself seems to be too slow, due to delay spent on \"Do you want to enable GPS?\" and its powering on. I propose to send email/SMS twice: first time with approximate coordinates (based on cell stations) - this should take not more than 2 seconds, second time with real GPS coordinates (takes up to 30 seconds on my device). Or at least make this behavior tunable.     10x
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: FANTASTIC
reviews.comment: I tested it by texting myself, and the map link was my PRECISE location. I\'m a 911 dispatcher, and locating a caller can be difficult. This could truly save your life.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Yes
reviews.comment: Great app to have
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: LG Optimus S
reviews.comment: Omg this app saved my life! I was in my bed and started choking on my gum! So I hit the buttons like crazy and my mom came and got me not even a minute later! THEN my sister and I were at track practice and some drunk dude with a gun got pn the field! My mom was there to pick us up in two minutes.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Needs more than one contact to send message to (at no cost)

reviews.comment: best

reviews.title: Amazing
reviews.comment: I\'ve got a pregnant girl and now I don\'t have to worry about her trying to play with her phone to get ahold of me she can just hit a button and I can find her
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Handy!
reviews.comment: This is a really cool idea... Women should definitely have it! Samsung Infuse.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Great
reviews.comment: Just one suggestion: Could the app be adjusted so it gives the phone\'s GPS a bit more time to turn on? I suffered a stroke and God forbid it happens again but it would be good to know I can send my location first time I push the red button. Apart from that excellent work and thanks.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Very Effective
reviews.comment: Seem to work fine. One click functionality is great.  I wish the two widget buttons were a single larger button, and could indicate a message in process.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Great!

reviews.comment: This is great.can\'t afford any other device. Due to my health I need something to get help. Wish I could notify at least 2 in case one is not availabl
